channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Netflix co-CEO Ted Sarandos argues its Warner Bros. deal won’t hurt consumers. If so, they can cancel with one click
item.description: Sarandos defended Netflix’s Warner Bros. merger and argued customers hold the real power.

item.title: Anthropic’s newest model excels at finding security vulnerabilities—but raises fresh cybersecurity risks
item.description: Claude Opus 4.6 identified over 500 previously unknown 'zero day' vulnerabilities, according to Anthropic security experts

item.title: Minneapolis fourth grader says ICE fears leave his 30-person class with just 7 students: ‘The teachers cry’
item.description: For many immigrant families in Minnesota, sending a child to school requires faith that federal immigration officers deployed around the state won’t d...

item.title: Dow soars by 1,200 points to top 50,000 for the first time as chipmakers and airlines lead ferocious stock market rebound
item.description: Even with Friday’s surge, the S&P 500 still fell to its third losing week in the last four.

item.title: USAID division killed by Trump is reborn after 2 mysterious donors give $48 million
item.description: "It’s wonderful that private funders have stepped up to help try to fill part of that gap but it’s only filling part of the gap.”

item.title: Dow's historic rise above 50K wraps rough week for stocks on a high note
Dow posts 1,200-point gain, eclipses 50,000 for first time as U.S stocks rebound
Dow Jones Industrial Average hits 50,000 level for first time ever
‘Hindenburg Omen’ spotted in U.S. stock market. Why it's ominous for investors.
Dow up over 1K points in final hour after hitting 50K for first time ever — live
